title: Man beaten to death on theft suspicion in Motijheel
body: A man was beaten to death on suspicion of theft at a residential building in the Arambagh area of Dhaka's Motijheel last night. The identity of the man, aged around 50, could not be known immediately, police said. The body was recovered from a staircase landing between the third and fourth floors of Karim Villa and sent to the Dhaka Medical College Hospital morgue for autopsy this morning. Sub-Inspector Kazi Arman Hossain of Motijheel Police Station confirmed the incident, saying the man had allegedly entered the building to commit theft. "He was reportedly caught while attempting to steal a mobile phone from a flat on the fifth floor and was beaten by residents, which led to his death," the SI said. The body bore multiple injury marks on the hands, back and legs, he added. Police have filed a murder case in connection with the incident. No arrests have been made so far. An investigation is underway to identify those involved and determine the exact sequence of events, police said.
